trans-unit.source: Move Web App Resources to another Resource Group
trans-unit.target: Move Web App Resources to another Resource Group

trans-unit.source: Describes the scenarios where you can move Web Apps and App Services from one Resource Group to another.
trans-unit.target: Describes the scenarios where you can move Web Apps and App Services from one Resource Group to another.

trans-unit.source: You can move Azure Web App resources using the <link><linkText>ARM Move Resources Api</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can move Azure Web App resources using the <link><linkText>ARM Move Resources Api</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Web Apps currently supports the following move scenarios:
trans-unit.target: Azure Web Apps currently supports the following move scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Moving the entire contents of a resource group (web apps, app service plans, and certificates) to another resource group
trans-unit.target: Moving the entire contents of a resource group (web apps, app service plans, and certificates) to another resource group

trans-unit.source: Note: The destination resource group can not contain any Microsoft.Web resources in this scenario
trans-unit.target: Note: The destination resource group can not contain any Microsoft.Web resources in this scenario

trans-unit.source: Moving individual web apps to a different resource group, while still hosting them in their current app service plan (the app service plan stays in the old resource group)
trans-unit.target: Moving individual web apps to a different resource group, while still hosting them in their current app service plan (the app service plan stays in the old resource group)
